Headlines.Headline: Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip
Headlines.Details: Attacks on schools during the Israeli invasion of Gaza An Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced people in Gaza kills 28 people and injures 54 others.

Headlines.Headline: Military aid to Israel during the Israel–Hamas war
Headlines.Details: Chancellor of Germany Olaf Scholz announces plans for Germany to supply Israel with a new shipment of weapons, and that the German government has agreed to continue shipments for at least the near future.

Headlines.Headline: 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon
Headlines.Details: An Israeli Merkava tank opens fire on a UNIFIL checkpoint in southern Lebanon , injuring two peacekeepers . Israeli troops also open fire on two other UN positions near the Blue Line , although no casualties are reported.

Headlines.Headline: Israeli
Headlines.Details: At least 22 people are killed in  airstrikes on two different areas in central Beirut , Lebanon.

Headlines.Headline: October 2024 Sudan airstrikes
Headlines.Details: Sudanese human rights group Emergency Lawyers reports that over 500 Sudanese civilians have been killed in airstrikes conducted by the Sudanese Armed Forces on multiple civilian areas held by the Rapid Support Forces .

Headlines.Headline: coal mine
Headlines.Details: At least twenty miners are killed and seven others are injured in an attack by unknown armed militants on a private  in Duki District , Balochistan , Pakistan .

Headlines.Headline: World Bank
Headlines.Details: The  approves a new financial intermediary fund consisting of grants from the United States , Japan , Canada , and other countries coupled with interest from frozen Russian assets to give to Ukraine as part of a $ 50 billion loan.

Headlines.Headline: Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War
Headlines.Details: Ukraine's  confirms the death of journalist Victoria Roshchyna who had been held prisoner by Russia since August 2023.

Headlines.Headline: Nobel Prize
Headlines.Details: This year's  in Literature is awarded to South Korean writer Han Kang "for her intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life”.

Headlines.Headline: Mollie Kathleen Gold Mine
Headlines.Details: One person is killed and twelve others are trapped when an elevator fails at the  in Cripple Creek , Colorado , United States .

Headlines.Headline: tornadoes
Headlines.Details: At least ten people are killed in damages by  caused by Hurricane Milton in Florida , United States.

Headlines.Headline: Living Planet report
Headlines.Details: In its annual  , the World Wildlife Fund estimates that wild populations of animal species have decreased over 70% since 1970, with some high-biodiversity areas seeing up to 95% declines.

Headlines.Headline: Italian
Headlines.Details: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni summons the Israeli ambassador to Italy after Israeli forces target bases manned by Italian peacekeepers in southern Lebanon .

Headlines.Headline: Federal Court of Malaysia
Headlines.Details: The  commutes the death sentence of Azilah Hadri, one of Altantuyaa's murderers, to 40 years imprisonment.

Headlines.Headline: Palestinian
Headlines.Details: Multiple  , Dutch , and Jewish human rights organizations sue the Dutch government for exporting weapons and military goods to Israel , thereby allegedly failing to prevent violations of the Genocide Convention and other war crimes in the Gaza Strip .

Sub-Themes.Sub-Theme: War crimes in the Israel–Hamas war

Headlines.Headline: United Nations
Headlines.Details: human rights investigators accuse Israel of crimes against humanity and the crime of extermination by deliberately targeting health facilities and medical personnel in Gaza.

Headlines.Headline: University of Granada
Headlines.Details: Researchers from the  confirm that bones lying in the Seville Cathedral in Seville , Andalusia , Spain , belonged to Christopher Columbus .

Headlines.Headline: Internet Archive
Headlines.Details: The  and the Wayback Machine are taken offline following a denial-of-service attack , with the hackers also stealing 31 million password hashes in a data breach .

Headlines.Headline: Erling Haaland
Headlines.Details: becomes the all-time top goalscorer of the Norway national football team with 34 goals in the last 36 matches, beating Jørgen Juve 's 1934 record of 33 goals.
